. It includes the villages of:  East Norwalk, West Norwalk, Cranbury, Silvermine, Winnipauk, Wilson Point, Harbor View, Rowayton and South Norwalk, known locally as "SoNo." Norwalk, probably due mostly to its proximity to
, is home to many large companies.

Norwalk has plenty of public transportation, buses and trains that create easy access to places all over the city.  Train stations make it easy to get into Norwalk from all over the area.  Most places can also be reached on foot within the different sections of the city.

value: content=Daily 10AM-5PM (Jul, Aug until 6PM). Great aquarium, plus lots of hands-on exhibits, and an IMAX theater. You can feed the seals.
content=Located in beautiful South Norwalk, the museum gives tourists a chance to go inside a landmark of the city.
content=Located in the Rowayton neighborhood. Experience the work of local artists. And discover the past of that part of the city.
. The arts center brings in all different kinds of artists and performers. Class can also be taken by many different kinds of professionals.
content=The Norwalk museum building used to be South Norwalk City hall and was built in 1912.  It holds historical information about the town of Norwalk.
content=Come and learn about the job of the switch tower operator.
content=Sound Navigation offers tours of local lighthouses, sunset cruises, and private charter boats.

content=Sheffield Island & Its Lighthouse The Norwalk Seaport Association has owned, restored and maintained Sheffield Island Lighthouse since 1986 and is the official U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service Friends group for the Norwalk Islands. Sheffield Island ferry tours are a top Fairfield County CT and Long Island Sound activity, attraction, tourist site, etc.  Great for kids and adults as a sightseeing, daytrip, and tourist destination. From May through September, visitors can board the Seaport Association’s 45-foot C.J. Toth catamaran for a cruise to the island then tour the lighthouse, observe wildlife in their natural habitat in the Stewart B. McKinney National Wildlife Refuge, hunt for shells along the beach, bring along a picnic lunch,play on the lawns around the lighthouse and just have a good time. The lighthouse is open to visitors for daily tours. The tower portion of the lighthouse is closed for renovations. No pets permitted on ferry or island.
Take a walk in historic South Norwalk and see the beautiful murals and statues placed around the town, by the seaport and down the to beach, it's a perfect picture spot!
content=Stepping Stones is an interactive museum for kids. It is recommended for kids age 1-10 and was named one of the top 50 museums for kids in America.
content=Crystal Theatre is an acting program for young to teenage kids.  They present plays for the community at reasonable prices.
content=The symphony consists of participants 18 and older and hold concerts occasionally.
content=The Norwalk Community Chorale Inc. presents free chorale concerts for those in Norwalk in the Spring and Fall.
content=Shakespeare presents Shakespearean plays over the summer near the Long Island Sound.
content=Silent, electric boat tours gives you a sense of serenity while plying the beautiful Norwalk Seaport.

content=Sheffield Island & Its Lighthouse  The Norwalk Seaport Association has owned, restored and maintained Sheffield Island Lighthouse since 1986 and is the official U.S. Fish & Wildlife Service Friends group for the Norwalk Islands. Sheffield Island ferry tours are a top Fairfield County CT and Long Island Sound activity, attraction, tourist site, etc.  Great for kids and adults as a sightseeing, daytrip, and tourist destination. From May through September, visitors can board the Seaport Association’s 45-foot C.J. Toth catamaran for a cruise to the island then tour the lighthouse, observe wildlife in their natural habitat in the Stewart B. McKinney National Wildlife Refuge, hunt for shells along the beach, bring along a picnic lunch,play on the lawns around the lighthouse and just have a good time. The lighthouse is open to visitors for daily tours. The tower portion of the lighthouse is closed for renovations. No pets permitted on ferry or island.

is home to some of the greatest shopping in Norwalk! specialty shops show what the city of Norwalk has to offer.  Great clothes and crafts, also shops for home decorating so you can take a piece of Norwalk with you!
is a great place for fresh fruits and veggies on a Saturday morning!

value: content=For some authentic and fresh waterfront eating. A small restaurant complete with a bar and indoor and outdoor sitting areas. Very reasonable pricing and casual, it's easy to feel very comfortable as you crack open a lobster claw and a beer on the water!
, South Main Street. And if you're a chocolate person then this is a great place to get your fix with every chocolate dish you can imagine!
content=All the food you can imagine, great seafood and local specialties, it's also fun for the whole family complete with live entertainment, crafts and a games and ride section!

content=Coromandel is an Indian restaurant on Washington Street. The garlic Naan (bread) here is amazing, any of Coromandel's Saag (spinach) or Gosht (lamb) dishes will make your day. The Tandoori Chicken and lunch buffet are also excellent.
content=Overton's is the local hot dog / hamburger shack. Cheap food and amazing view of the harbor make this a local favorite.
content=American Steak House is a buffet style family restaurant.
content=The homey,country style tavern is home to an inn and restaurant.  It has a lovely view of a local miniature waterfall.
content=This New York feeling Pizzeria is a cheap place for dinner in the middle of downtown South Norwalk.
content=New York Bakery is family owned with great breakfast and deli sandwiches.  They sell cakes and pastries of all kinds.
content=Los Cabos is a moderately priced authentic Mexican restaurant with great food and desserts.

Local bars and restaurants on Washington Street provide great night life for the older crowd.  With open store fronts and multiple themed establishments, there is something for everyone.

If you're a coffee fan then
is the place for you, a low-key coffee shop with comfortable seating and good food.

value: content=O'Neill's is an Irish Pub in the middle of downtown South Norwalk (SoNo) and offers cocktail parties, buffet dinners, a bar, and restaurant area.

content=The East Side Cafe is both a restaurant and bar. The restaurant is located on the lower floor, while the bar is on the second floor.  The bar includes 9 televisions, for the ability to have many different sporting events on simultaneously.  They also have live entertainment.
content=Black Bear is a lively bar/restaurant located in the center of downtown South Norwalk (SoNo).  They have great food and live entertainment.
content=In the business district and across from the Merritt 7 Corporate Park.

content=The Doubletree is a very modern, newly renovated hotel in Southern Connecticut. The hotel accommodates business and leisure travelers, and has many types of rooms including suites, executive suites, and accessible rooms. The Doubletree is located directly off I-95.
content=Just off I-95, Route 7, and the Merritt Parkway. It has accessible rooms, and is in close proximity to many Fortune 500 companies. It is also a 100% smoke free hotel.
content=This suite style hotel has studio, deluxe studio and 2 room suites. The suites include a sleeping area, kitchen, dining area, and working area.
content=Banquet, meeting rooms, and wedding availabilities.
